Articles.Content:
how much seats have the capsules?

Spud - the sphere - is one seat

Radish - the cone shaped one - is two seats.

I made a little shuttle using your parts!

Launch

Start of orbital burn

To the Mun!

In Munar Orbit

Burning Up (In a good way)

This is how shuttles land, right?

Success!
Well at least it didn't break apart when it "landed" in the water. Also first time I've seen pictures of the Radish being used for an aircraft, although I've heard stories.
Well I'll be honest, this is version 2; the first version did break apart in the water. My Kerbal policy is "MOAR PARACHUTES!"

Hey Orion, did you know that the Gemini "Big G" crew compartment from FASA fits really well with your pod? I made a Big G interplanetary ship earlier:

I know you've got a bunch of stuff you're working on, but maybe you could consider making your own Big G crew compartment? Perhaps based on the Pumpkin lander? I don't mean to pester, but Big G is my favorite alternate history spacecraft!

Edited May 21, 2014 by DGatsby
correction

Hey Orion, did you know that the Gemini "Big G" crew compartment from FASA fits really well with your pod? I made a Big G interplanetary ship earlier:

http://i.imgur.com/gIGMC5k.png

I know you've got a bunch of stuff you're working on, but maybe you could consider making your own Big G crew compartment? Perhaps based on the Pumpkin lander? I don't mean to pester, but Big G is my favorite alternate history spacecraft!

Hey that's not a bad fit, nice. I've thought about making a Big R and others have asked for it. Maybe when I've got more of the other stuff I'm working on finished I'll do one.
Cool! I'm excited to see what you come up with.

I see a lot of potential for widening the view, basically could you make the windows larger?

Also if you could make the hatch a little bigger I don't know how the heck the Kerbals squeeze through that.

Besides that The Radish is my 'go to' ship.

I see a lot of potential for widening the view, basically could you make the windows larger?

http://i.imgur.com/Gnmv41f.png

Also if you could make the hatch a little bigger I don't know how the heck the Kerbals squeeze through that.

Besides that The Radish is my 'go to' ship.

You can click on the window to see through it.

You can click on the window to see through it.

But that doesn't change the fact that bigger windows would be nice.

Dunno if anyone else has done this, but for those who wanted this 2 man to be more "Gemini", here's what I managed with Procedural Fairings:

The aft section contains RCS tanks, a Fuel tank, 3 rocket engines, a battery, and a Mechjeb. The nose cone has a Jr docking port, RealChute parachute, and there are 4 single point RCS motors at 45 degree angles fore and aft.

Edited July 9, 2014 by tg626

Dunno if anyone else has done this, but for those who wanted this 2 man to be more "Gemini", here's what I managed with Procedural Fairings:

http://i1172.photobucket.com/albums/r568/PA626/Kerbal%20Space%20Program/screenshot37_zps10062b21.png

The aft section contains RCS tanks, a Fuel tank, 3 rocket engines, and a Mechjeb. The nose cone has a Jr docking port, RealChute parachute, and there are 4 single point RCS motors at 45 degree angles fore and aft.

Nice ^^ If you're looking to use the radish gemini style I'd advise you to check out the R&D (beta) version of this mod. (Link in sig) In it the radish has been redone to use different specialized decouplers instead of auto shrouds. The largest decoupler acts as a service module with fuel and monopropellant stored inside. The pack also includes an inline chute that woks well for both the mk1 pod and radish to do mercury and gemini respectively and is realchute compatable.

I'm conservative about adding mods, but it looks good and I'll keep it in mind.

Might be worth mentioning, the capsule as shown still needs a tapered adapter to fit the next size up stock parts. It stays attached to the final stage of my launcher and so it isn't shown.

Fair enough, the R&D version will eventually be brought over to the main release, but the new file structure I use in it makes it easy to delete unwanted parts.

Since I'm posting in this thread, I should mention, if anyone uses RasterPropMonitors the R&D version is upgraded to support the newer RPM release.

Dunno if anyone else has done this, but for those who wanted this 2 man to be more "Gemini", here's what I managed with Procedural Fairings:

http://i1172.photobucket.com/albums/r568/PA626/Kerbal%20Space%20Program/screenshot37_zps10062b21.png

The aft section contains RCS tanks, a Fuel tank, 3 rocket engines, a battery, and a Mechjeb. The nose cone has a Jr docking port, RealChute parachute, and there are 4 single point RCS motors at 45 degree angles fore and aft.

That looks very similiar to my Radish basedVA capsule for the LKS. This uses the SM module Orionkermin mentions and procedural parts.

Also very nice. Figuring out ways to build what you want is at least half the fun of this game!

BTW...

Is it me or could the 2 man capsule use a bit more buoyancy?

Hi..Mr. Orionkermin.

I'm a fan of your Radish pod.

got a request here..i know its a bit petty...but i think the IVA needs to have joysticks.

doesn't the seat by default comes with joysticks?

thank you in advance.

Hi..Mr. Orionkermin.

I'm a fan of your Radish pod.

got a request here..i know its a bit petty...but i think the IVA needs to have joysticks.

doesn't the seat by default comes with joysticks?

thank you in advance.

The default seats aren't props so I don't actually have access to them. The good news is that the seats I made over in the Beta(R&D) version of this mod, have control sticks. This version will hopefully be getting an update around Monday-ish.

HGR re-released for KSP.24

The mod now includes many changes and new parts, check out the OP for details!
Thx! Now i'm all set for .24. With KW's 5m parts and your 1.875 ones, my space program will know a big diversification!

My Kerbal Space Agency has been looking for a suitable command pod that would allow me to package a pair of victims...er I mean volunteers together. :wink:The Radish Command pod is just what I was looking for. Many thanks.

The default seats aren't props so I don't actually have access to them. The good news is that the seats I made over in the Beta(R&D) version of this mod, have control sticks. This version will hopefully be getting an update around Monday-ish.

Look at Tantares mod or Habitat Pack. Both use stock seats.

And one more bug: you have `FlighSeat` and `FlightSeat2` props in HGR 1.0 pack but only `FlightSeat2` is used.
Such a great mod!

I mentioned in the other thread, but I should post it here, if you're already using the beta version you might want to stick with it. It has a few more WIP parts that aren't here yet and it'll continue to be the first place I release anything new. Thanks everyone.

@Shaw:

The seats are still a part of the model in the stock pods rather than actual props. I kinda like that I have my own seat anyway though. Thanks for letting me know that the old one is still there though, I'll have to get rid of it.

I love the Radish pod. It really fills a hole in the game.

I do wonder about the texture, though. It just looks unfinished to me. I darkened the top half to match the bottom because it bothered me.

Edited July 22, 2014 by razark
